thread.title: Three hurt in golf buggy accident on Hamilton Island | Gold Coast Bulletin
thread.title_full: Three hurt in golf buggy accident on Hamilton Island | Gold Coast Bulletin

title: Three hurt in golf buggy accident on Hamilton Island | Gold Coast Bulletin
text:
Three hurt in golf buggy accident on Hamilton Island Peter Michael, Darren Cartwright, The Courier-Mail February 27, 2017 5:15pm 
TWO men are being airlifted to hospital, one with two suspected broken legs, after a golf buggy plunged up to 20m off a cliff on Hamilton Island. 
A second man reportedly has a significant arm injury, a laceration to the head and back pain 
Up to four were men were believed to have been on the buggy when the incident occurred just before 12.30pm. 
A spokeswoman for the Queensland Ambulance Service said paramedics had flown to the medical centre on Hamilton Island to assess the victims. 
Paramedics say the two patients, one in his 30s, the other in his late 20s, suffered “multiple injuries” in the crash about 12.20pm today. 
“A man in his early 30s has reportedly has a significant arm injury, a laceration to the head and back pain and they were querying a chest injury,” the spokeswoman told The Courier-Mail. 
It was unclear what injuries, if any, the man his late 20s has sustained. 
“Four men were in a buggy going up a hill when it has gone off the edge of a cliff this afternoon,’’ a police spokesman said. 
“It has plunged between 15m and 20m. Paramedics on scene at a golf buggy incident, Hamilton Island #Whitsundays at about 12.20pm. Reports of 3 patients. Helo has been tasked. — Queensland Ambulance (@QldAmbulance) February 27, 2017 
“The man with the two suspected broken legs appears to have suffered the most serious injury. 
“A rescue helicopter has been tasked to fly to Hamilton island and airlift him back to Mackay Hospital.’’ 
It is understood the golf buggy, the most popular form of transport on the resort island, was privately owned. 
In March last year, nine people were injured when a golf buggy towing a luggage trailer crashed into a parked golf cart on the Great Northern Highway on the island.
